title: dynamic-event-calendar
description: Dynamic-event-calendar is a project showcasing an interactive and responsive event calendar built using JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This repository demonstrates how to create a dynamic web application for managing and displaying events, focusing on a user-friendly interface and modern web development practices.

title: iot-asset-tracking
description: iot-asset-tracking is a web application built with Next.js, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS for managing and tracking IoT assets. It leverages Supabase for data storage and authentication, providing a robust platform for visualizing asset location and related data, ideal for projects involving IoT device management and real-time tracking solutions.

title: robofleet-dashboard
description: The robofleet-dashboard repository provides a web-based interface for visualizing and interacting with Robofleet, built using JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS. This project aims to provide a user-friendly dashboard for monitoring robot status, managing tasks, and analyzing data related to robotic fleets.

title: next-voting
description: Next-voting is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript, designed to implement a modern and efficient voting system. This repository contains the source code for a platform focused on providing a secure and user-friendly experience for creating and participating in polls, leveraging modern web technologies to deliver a responsive and accessible application.

title: sleep-debt-tracker
description: Sleep-debt-tracker is a project built with TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML designed to help users track and manage their sleep debt. This application provides a simple and intuitive interface for logging sleep hours and visualizing sleep patterns to promote better sleep habits. As a project demonstrating practical TypeScript usage, this repository showcases a combination of front-end technologies for building a user-friendly sleep management tool.

title: next-idea-board
description: Next-idea-board is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript that serves as a collaborative digital whiteboard for brainstorming and organizing ideas. This repository focuses on providing a flexible and user-friendly platform for project planning, ideation, and visual collaboration within teams.

title: ros-log-viewer
description: ros-log-viewer is a web-based tool for visualizing and analyzing ROS (Robot Operating System) log files. Built with JavaScript, Python, HTML, and CSS, it provides a user-friendly interface to parse, filter, and display log data, aiding in debugging and understanding ROS system behavior. This project focuses on streamlining the ROS log analysis process, making it easier for developers and researchers to gain insights from their robot's performance.

title: Map-Visualisation
description: Map-Visualisation is a project utilizing HTML and Python to create interactive map visualizations. This repository demonstrates techniques for displaying geographical data and insights through visually engaging maps, focusing on practical applications within the broader project context.

title: jovian
description: Jovian is a full-stack CRUD application built with Python and Flask, utilizing PostgreSQL for data persistence. This project showcases a complete web application architecture, encompassing HTML, CSS, and Python for front-end and back-end development, along with shell scripting for deployment and maintenance. It serves as a practical example for learning and implementing CRUD operations, database integration, and general web development principles within a Python-based environment.

title: resume
description: This repository contains the source code for my resume, primarily written in TeX for generating a professional-looking PDF document. It also includes an HTML version for online viewing. This project serves as a personal showcase and falls under the category of personal projects and resume building resources.

title: genietalks
description: GenieTalks is a project built with TypeScript, CSS, JavaScript, HTML, and Vitejs, leveraging Express.js and the Gemini API to create a user interface or application focused on conversational AI or interaction with Google's Gemini models. This repository serves as a demonstration or implementation of Gemini's capabilities within a modern web application.

title: NextJs-Dashboard
description: NextJs-Dashboard is a project demonstrating a modern dashboard implementation using Next.js, TypeScript, CSS, and JavaScript. It serves as a practical example for building scalable and interactive user interfaces, showcasing best practices for data fetching, component architecture, and styling within a Next.js environment. This repository is focused on project development and offers a valuable resource for developers learning or applying Next.js to dashboard creation.

Project 22052177 is a web-based application built using TypeScript, JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. This project encompasses various functionalities related to the specified project topic, leveraging modern web development practices and a combination of statically-typed and dynamically-typed JavaScript languages for enhanced maintainability and scalability.

title: atg-world
description: The atg-world repository is a project built using TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML, and CSS. It focuses on exploring and implementing various functionalities, potentially related to a virtual world or simulation environment, as suggested by the "project" topic. This repository showcases the integration of front-end technologies for interactive and dynamic web applications.

title: finance-with-python
description: This repository, built using Jupyter Notebook and Python, contains projects and tutorials focused on applying Python to various finance-related tasks. It explores topics such as financial analysis, portfolio management, data visualization, and algorithmic trading, providing practical examples and code snippets for learning and experimentation in the field of finance with Python.

title: devboard
description: Devboard is a project management application built with Next.js 14 (using the pages router), TypeScript, and React Query for efficient data fetching and state management. Leveraging Material UI (MUI) for a clean and responsive user interface, this repository serves as a practical example of building a full-stack application with modern web technologies, covering topics like component-based architecture, API integration, and TypeScript best practices.
